channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Munich conference ends with Europe looking for a future less dependent on the U.S.
item.description: As the Munich Security Conference wraps up, reassurances from Marco Rubio met a Europe questioning whether it can — and must — stand on its own.
item.content:encoded: As the Munich Security Conference wraps up, reassurances from Marco Rubio met a Europe questioning whether it can — and must — stand on its own.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Former DHS Secretary Napolitano talks about the past and future of ICE
item.description: As Congress stalls on DHS funding and debates body cameras and warrants for ICE raids, former DHS Secretary Janet Napolitano talks about the department's past and future.
item.content:encoded: As Congress stalls on DHS funding and debates body cameras and warrants for ICE raids, former DHS Secretary Janet Napolitano talks about the department's past and future.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Robbins

item.title: Landmark tech trials on social media addiction seen through a mother's eyes
item.description: With multiple tech addiction trials expected this year, Julianna Arnold of the parents group 'Parents Rise' says the legal pressure is overdue for Big Tech.
item.content:encoded: With multiple tech addiction trials expected this year, Julianna Arnold of the parents group 'Parents Rise' says the legal pressure is overdue for Big Tech.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Robbins

item.title: Life Kit's advice to repair your relationship
item.description: We cannot avoid fights and disagreements in relationships. So, how do we move forward? NPR's Life Kit offers advice on repairing relationships in the midst of conflict.
item.content:encoded: We cannot avoid fights and disagreements in relationships. So, how do we move forward? NPR's Life Kit offers advice on repairing relationships in the midst of conflict.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: Chef's soup dumpling lesson doubles as a love letter to DC's Chinatown
item.description: Chef Tim Ma, owner of Lucky Danger in Washington's Chinatown, walks us through how to fold soup dumplings in preparation for Lunar New Year celebrations.
item.content:encoded: Chef Tim Ma, owner of Lucky Danger in Washington's Chinatown, walks us through how to fold soup dumplings in preparation for Lunar New Year celebrations.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: What's your favorite depiction of POTUS on the big screen?
item.description: In honor of President's Day, an NPR panel picks their favorite depictions of POTUS in film.
item.content:encoded: In honor of President's Day, an NPR panel picks their favorite depictions of POTUS in film.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: 'Pillion' drops a timid singer into a gay biker BDSM world
item.description: A24's new film Pillion follows a timid singer pulled into a biker's BDSM relationship. Alexander Skarsgård talks about his enigmatic character in the movie.
item.content:encoded: A24's new film Pillion follows a timid singer pulled into a biker's BDSM relationship. Alexander Skarsgård talks about his enigmatic character in the movie.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. Sánchez

item.title: Why do humans kiss?
item.description: Matilda Brindle, an evolutionary biologist at the University of Oxford, explains.
item.content:encoded: Matilda Brindle, an evolutionary biologist at the University of Oxford, explains.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: The rising cost of online betting addiction among young people
item.description: In an era when you can bet on almost any sporting event on your phone, it is no surprise that gambling addiction is on the rise. Young men are particularly likely to get in too deep. WBUR's Patrick Madden reports from Massachusetts.
item.content:encoded: In an era when you can bet on almost any sporting event on your phone, it is no surprise that gambling addiction is on the rise. Young men are particularly likely to get in too deep. WBUR's Patrick Madden reports from Massachusetts.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Madden

item.title: 'Gilmore Girls' podcast brings fans together
item.description: From fan festivals to new friendships, 'Gilmore Girls' has built a community beyond the screen, says Lily Tyson, series producer of 'Generation Gilmore Girls' from Connecticut Public Radio.
item.content:encoded: From fan festivals to new friendships, 'Gilmore Girls' has built a community beyond the screen, says Lily Tyson, series producer of 'Generation Gilmore Girls' from Connecticut Public Radio.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu
